text: A dynamically generated web page displays different content each time the page is viewed.
What is the first thing web browsers do with client-side content?

answers.text: Processes the code embedded in the web page
Displays updated content to the user

text: Stored XSS vulnerabilities can be exploited for which browser-based attacks?
note: Stored XSS vulnerabilities can be exploited for the following browser-based attacks: hijacking another user’s browser, capturing sensitive information viewed by application users, pseudo defacement of the application, port scanning of internal hosts, directed delivery of browser-based exploits, and other malicious activities.

text: When untrusted user-supplied data is used to update the DOM with an unsafe JavaScript call, you have a________.
note: When untrusted user-supplied data is used to update the DOM with an unsafe JavaScript call, you have a client XSS. You call a JavaScript call unsafe if you can inject valid JavaScript into the DOM.

text: To exploit a stored XSS vulnerability, you need to have a malicious link.
You add code to validate the input received to make sure no unwanted data gets into the application.
Which of the following use the same syntaxes?
note: You will need to be context sensitive as HTML, JavaScript, CSS, and URLs use different syntaxes. You will need to handle each separately as each will have a different form of escaping.

text: Browsers try to determine an appropriate response by sniffing at the character and the HTML markup.
What can you use to identify XSS vulnerabilities within web applications?
note: You can use security scanning software to identify XSS vulnerabilities within web applications. You can also use any one of the vulnerability assessment tools, like IBM AppScan, Nessus, or any other tools.

text: Cross-site scripting is also known as?
note: Cross-site scripting is also called XSS.

text: My anti-virus software can protect from XSS attacks.
note: Antivirus software protects you from viruses and other types of malicious code that may be obtained from XSS vulnerability. Some antivirus software can detect known types of malware, but they cannot prevent XSS from occurring.

text: Which one of the following is one of the most common attacks?
note: Cross-site scripting is one of the most common attacks.

text: Which one of the following tools can not exploit stored XSS?
note: Nessus is a vulnerability assessment tool and vulnerability assessment tools can not exploit any vulnerability but only list vulnerabilities.

text: What are the most common locations of reflected XSS?
note: The most common locations of reflected XSS are in error messages or search results.

text: What does the abbreviation DOM stand for?
The DOM enables dynamic scripts, like JavaScript, to reference components of the document.
note: The DOM enables dynamic scripts like, JavaScript, to reference components of the document.

text: What framework rules prevent against cross-site scripting vulnerabilities?
note: OWASP foundation’s rules prevent against cross-site scripting vulnerability.

text: What two OWASP rules allow for sufficient protection against XSS vulnerabilities for most organizations?
note: Rule 1 and Rule 2 are sufficient for most organizations.

text: There is a single way to detect XSS in applications.
note: There is no single way to detect XSS in applications.

text: What is the other name for Code review?
note: Code review is also known as peer review.

text: DOM Based cross-site scripting is an attack. How is the attack payload executed?
note: DOM-based cross-site scripting is an attack where the attack payload is executed by modifying the DOM environment.
